00034 //       ~~~~~~~~~  mmdb::HetCompounds (HETNAM, HETSYN, FORMULA records)
00035 //                  mmdb::SSContainer  (container for helixes and turns)
00036 //                  mmdb::Helix        ( helix info                    )

00069   class HetCompound : public io::Stream  {
00070 
00071     public :
00072 
00073       ResName  hetID;      // Het identifiers, right-justified
00074       pstr     comment;
00075       int      nSynonyms;
00076       psvector hetSynonym; // synonyms
00077       int      compNum;    // component number
00078       char     wc;         // '*' for water, otherwise space
00079       pstr     Formula;    // formulas
00080 
00081       HetCompound ( cpstr HetName );
00082       HetCompound ( io::RPStream Object );
00083       ~HetCompound();
00084 
00085       void  AddKeyWord     ( cpstr W, bool Closed );
00086       void  HETNAM_PDBDump ( io::RFile f );
00087       void  HETSYN_PDBDump ( io::RFile f );
00088       void  FORMUL_PDBDump ( io::RFile f );
00089 
00090       void  FormComString  ( pstr & F );
00091       void  FormSynString  ( pstr & F );
00092       void  FormForString  ( pstr & F );
00093 
00094       void  Copy  ( PHetCompound hetCompound );
00095 
00096       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00097       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00098 
00099     protected :
00100 
00101       void  InitHetCompound ( cpstr HetName );
00102       void  FreeMemory      ();
00103 
00104   };

00131   class Helix : public ContainerClass  {
00132 
00133     public :
00134       int     serNum;      // serial number
00135       HelixID helixID;     // helix ID
00136       ResName initResName; // name of the helix's initial residue
00137       ChainID initChainID; // chain ID for the chain containing the helix
00138       int     initSeqNum;  // sequence number of the initial residue
00139       InsCode initICode;   // insertion code of the initial residue
00140       ResName endResName;  // name of the helix's terminal residue
00141       ChainID endChainID;  // chain ID for the chain containing the helix
00142       int     endSeqNum;   // sequence number of the terminal residue
00143       InsCode endICode;    // insertion code of the terminal residue
00144       int     helixClass;  // helix class
00145       pstr    comment;     // comment about the helix
00146       int     length;      // length of the helix
00147 
00148       Helix ();
00149       Helix ( cpstr S );
00150       Helix ( io::RPStream Object );
00151       ~Helix();
00152 
00153       void       PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr S, int N   );
00154       void       MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData CIF, int N );
00155       ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr S );
00156       ERROR_CODE GetCIF          ( mmcif::PData CIF, int & n );
00157       CLASS_ID   GetClassID      () { return ClassID_Helix; }
00158 
00159       void  Copy  ( PContainerClass Helix );
00160 
00161       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00162       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00163 
00164     protected :
00165 
00166       void InitHelix();
00167 
00168   };

00172   //  ====================  Strand  ============================
00173 
00174   DefineClass(Strand);
00175   DefineStreamFunctions(Strand);
00176 
00177   class Strand : public io::Stream  {
00178 
00179     public :
00180 
00181       StrandID sheetID;     // sheet ID
00182       int      strandNo;    // strand number
00183       ResName  initResName; // name of the strand's initial residue
00184       ChainID  initChainID; // chain ID of initial residue in the strand
00185       int      initSeqNum;  // sequence number of the initial residue
00186       InsCode  initICode;   // insertion code of the initial residue
00187       ResName  endResName;  // name of the strand's terminal residue
00188       ChainID  endChainID;  // chain ID of terminal residue in the strand
00189       int      endSeqNum;   // sequence number of the terminal residue
00190       InsCode  endICode;    // insertion code of the terminal residue
00191       int      sense;       // sense of strand with respect to previous
00192                             //    strand
00193       AtomName curAtom;     // registration; atom name in current strand
00194       ResName  curResName;  // registration; residue name in current
00195                             //    strand
00196       ChainID  curChainID;  // registration; chain ID in current strand
00197       int      curResSeq;   // registration; res-e seq numb in current
00198                             //    strand
00199       InsCode  curICode;    // registration; ins code in current strand
00200       AtomName prevAtom;    // registration; atom name in previous strand
00201       ResName  prevResName; // registration; residue name in previous
00202                             //    strand
00203       ChainID  prevChainID; // registration; chain ID in previous strand
00204       int      prevResSeq;  // registration; res-e seq numb in previous
00205                             //    strand
00206       InsCode  prevICode;   // registration; ins code in previous strand
00207 
00208       Strand ();
00209       Strand ( io::RPStream Object );
00210       ~Strand();
00211 
00212       void       PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr  S );
00213       void       MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData CIF );
00214       ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr S );
00215       int        GetCIF          ( mmcif::PData CIF, cpstr sheet_id );
00216 
00217       void  Copy  ( PStrand Strand );
00218 
00219       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00220       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00221 
00222     protected :
00223 
00224       void InitStrand();
00225 
00226   };

00409   class Link : public ContainerClass  {
00410 
00411     public :
00412       AtomName atName1;   // name of 1st linked atom
00413       AltLoc   aloc1;     // alternative location of 1st linked atom
00414       ResName  resName1;  // residue name of 1st linked atom
00415       ChainID  chainID1;  // chain ID of 1st linked atom
00416       int      seqNum1;   // sequence number of 1st linked atom
00417       InsCode  insCode1;  // insertion code of 1st linked atom
00418       AtomName atName2;   // name of 2nd linked atom
00419       AltLoc   aloc2;     // alternative location of 2nd linked atom
00420       ResName  resName2;  // residue name of 2nd linked atom
00421       ChainID  chainID2;  // chain ID of 2nd linked atom
00422       int      seqNum2;   // sequence number of 2nd linked atom
00423       InsCode  insCode2;  // insertion code of 2nd linked atom
00424       int      s1,i1,j1,k1;  // sym id of 1st atom
00425       int      s2,i2,j2,k2;  // sym id of 2nd atom
00426 
00427       Link ();
00428       Link ( cpstr S );
00429       Link ( io::RPStream Object );
00430       ~Link();
00431 
00432       void       PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr S, int N   );
00433       void       MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData CIF, int N );
00434       ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr S );
00435       ERROR_CODE GetCIF          ( mmcif::PData CIF, int & n );
00436       CLASS_ID   GetClassID      () { return ClassID_Link; }
00437 
00438       void  Copy  ( PContainerClass link );
00439 
00440       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00441       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00442 
00443     protected :
00444 
00445       void InitLink();
00446 
00447   };

00468   //  ====================  LinkR  ============================
00469 
00470   DefineClass(LinkR);
00471   DefineStreamFunctions(LinkR);
00472 
00473   /*
00474 
00475   Garib's
00476   LINK             LYS A  27                     PLP A 255                PLPLYS
00477   LINK             MAN S   3                     MAN S   4                BETA1-4
00478   LINK        C6  BBEN B   1                O1  BMAF S   2                BEN-MAF
00479   LINK        OE2 AGLU A 320                C1  AMAF S   2                GLU-MAF
00480   LINK        OE2  GLU A  67        1.895   ZN   ZN  R   5                GLU-ZN
00481   LINK        NE2  HIS A  71        2.055   ZN   ZN  R   5                HIS-ZN
00482   LINK        O    ARG A  69        2.240   NA   NA  R   9                ARG-NA
00483 
00484   Coot's
00485   LINKR        O   VAL C 103                NA    NA C 401                VAL-NA
00486   LINKR        OD1 ASP D  58                NA    NA D 401                ASP-NA
00487   LINKR        O   ALA D  97                NA    NA D 401                ALA-NA
00488   LINKR        OG1 THR D  99                NA    NA D 401                THR-NA
00489   LINKR        O   SER D 101                NA    NA D 401                SER-NA
00490   LINKR        O   VAL D 103                NA    NA D 401                VAL-NA
00491 
00492   PDB's
00493   LINK         O   GLY A  49                NA    NA A6001     1555   1555  2.98
00494   LINK         OG1 THR A  51                NA    NA A6001     1555   1555  2.72
00495   LINK         OD2 ASP A  66                NA    NA A6001     1555   1555  2.72
00496   LINK         NE  ARG A  68                NA    NA A6001     1555   1555  2.93
00497 
00498   LINK         NE  ARG A  68                NA    NA A6001     1555   1555  2.93
00499   LINK         C21 2EG A   7                 C22 2EG B  19     1555   1555  1.56
00500   */
00501 
00502   class LinkR : public ContainerClass  {
00503 
00504     public :
00505       LinkRID  linkRID;   // link name
00506       AtomName atName1;   // name of 1st linked atom
00507       AltLoc   aloc1;     // alternative location of 1st linked atom
00508       ResName  resName1;  // residue name of 1st linked atom
00509       ChainID  chainID1;  // chain ID of 1st linked atom
00510       int      seqNum1;   // sequence number of 1st linked atom
00511       InsCode  insCode1;  // insertion code of 1st linked atom
00512       AtomName atName2;   // name of 2nd linked atom
00513       AltLoc   aloc2;     // alternative location of 2nd linked atom
00514       ResName  resName2;  // residue name of 2nd linked atom
00515       ChainID  chainID2;  // chain ID of 2nd linked atom
00516       int      seqNum2;   // sequence number of 2nd linked atom
00517       InsCode  insCode2;  // insertion code of 2nd linked atom
00518       realtype dist;      // link distance
00519 
00520       LinkR ();
00521       LinkR ( cpstr S );
00522       LinkR ( io::RPStream Object );
00523       ~LinkR();
00524 
00525       void       PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr S, int N   );
00526       void       MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData CIF, int N );
00527       ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr S );
00528       ERROR_CODE GetCIF          ( mmcif::PData CIF, int & n );
00529       CLASS_ID   GetClassID      () { return ClassID_LinkR; }
00530 
00531       void  Copy  ( PContainerClass LinkR );
00532 
00533       void  write ( io::RFile f );
00534       void  read  ( io::RFile f );
00535 
00536     protected :

00539

00568   class CisPep : public ContainerClass  {
00569 
00570     public :
00571       int      serNum;   //  record serial number
00572       ResName  pep1;     //  residue name

00575       InsCode  icode1;   //  insertion code 1
00576       ResName  pep2;     //  residue name 2
00577       ChainID  chainID2; //  chain identifier 2
00578       int      seqNum2;  //  residue sequence number 2
00579       InsCode  icode2;   //  insertion code 2
00580       int      modNum;   //  model number
00581       realtype measure;  //  measure of the angle in degrees.
00582

00607   enum SSE_RC  {
00608     SSERC_Ok           = 0,
00609     SSERC_noResidues   = 1,
00610     SSERC_noAminoacids = 2,
00611     SSERC_noSSE        = 3
00612   };

00618 
00619   DefineFactoryFunctions(Model);
00620 
00621   class Model : public ProModel  {
00622 
00623     friend class Manager;
00624     friend class BondManager;
00625     friend class SelManager;
00626     friend class CoorManager;
00627     friend class Root;
00628     friend class Chain;
00629     friend class Residue;
00630     friend class Atom;
00631 
00632     public :
00633 
00634       Model ();  // SetMMDBFile() MUST be used after this constructor!
00635       Model ( PManager MMDBF, int serialNum );
00636       Model ( io::RPStream Object );
00637       ~Model();
00638 
00639       void   SetMMDBManager ( PManager MMDBM, int serialNum );
00640       PManager GetCoordHierarchy() { return manager; }
00641 
00642       //   GetChainCreate() returns pointer on chain, whose identifier
00643       // is given in chID. If such a chain is absent in the model,
00644       // it is created. If enforceUniqueChainID is true and chain with
00645       // the same first letter in chain ID already exists in the model,
00646       // then the new chain ID will be appended with a serial number
00647       // in order to keep it unique. The model will contain chains like
00648       // A, A0, A1, A2, ... in such cases.
00649       PChain GetChainCreate ( const ChainID chID,
00650                               bool enforceUniqueChainID );
00651 
00652       //   CreateChain() creates a new chain with chain ID regardless
00653       // the presence of same-ID chains in the model. This function
00654       // was introduced only for compatibility with older CCP4
00655       // applications and using it in any new developments should be
00656       // strictly discouraged.
00657       PChain CreateChain    ( const ChainID chID );
00658 
00659       cpstr  GetEntryID ();
00660       void   SetEntryID ( const IDCode idCode );
00661 
00662       int    GetSerNum  (); // returns the model's serial number
00663 
00664       cpstr  GetModelID ( pstr modelID );  // returns "/mdl"
00665 
00666       int    GetNumberOfModels  (); // returns TOTAL number of models

00796 
00797       //   GetAtomTable1(..) returns atom table without TER atoms and
00798       // without NULL atom pointers. NumberOfAtoms returns the actual
00799       // number of atom pointers in atomTable.
00800       //   atomTable is allocated withing the function. If it was
00801       // not set to NULL before calling the function, the latter will
00802       // attempt to deallocate it first.
00803       //   The application is responsible for deleting atomTable,
00804       // however it must not touch atom pointers, i.e. use simply
00805       // "delete atomTable;". Never pass atomTable from GetAtomTable(..)
00806       // into this function, unless you set it to NULL before doing that.
00807       void GetAtomTable1 ( const ChainID chainID, int seqNo,
00808                            const InsCode insCode,
00809                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00810       void GetAtomTable1 ( int   chainNo, int seqNo,
00811                            const InsCode insCode,
00812                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00813       void GetAtomTable1 ( const ChainID chainID, int resNo,
00814                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00815       void GetAtomTable1 ( int     chainNo,     int resNo,
00816                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );

00860       //  DeleteAltLocs() leaves only alternative location with maximal
00861       // occupancy, if those are equal or unspecified, the one with
00862       // "least" alternative location indicator.
00863       //  The function returns the number of deleted. All tables remain
00864       // untrimmed, so that explicit trimming or calling
00865       // FinishStructEdit() is required.
00866       int DeleteAltLocs();

00902 
00903       //   MoveChain(..) adds chain m_chain on the top Chain array.
00904       // The pointer on chain is then set to NULL (m_chain=NULL).
00905       // If chain_ext is greater than 0, the moved chain will be
00906       // forcefully renamed; the new name is composed as the previous
00907       // one + underscore + chain_ext (e.g. A_1). If thus generated
00908       // name duplicates any of existing chain IDs, or if chain_ext
00909       // was set to 0 and there is a duplication of chain IDs, the
00910       // name is again modified as above, with the extension number
00911       // generated automatically (this may result in IDs like
00912       // A_1_10).
00913       //   m_atom must give pointer to the Atom array, from which
00914       // the atoms belonging to m_chain, are moved to Atom array
00915       // given by 'atom', starting from poisition 'atom_index'.
00916       // 'atom_index' is then automatically updated to the next
00917       // free position in 'atom'.
00918       //   Note1: the moved atoms will occupy a continuous range
00919       // in 'atom' array; no checks on whether the corresponding
00920       // cells are occupied or not, are performed.
00921       //   Note2: the 'atom_index' is numbered from 0 on, i.e.
00922       // it is equal to atom[atom_index]->index-1; atom[]->index
00923       // is assigned automatically.
00924       void  MoveChain ( PChain & m_chain, PPAtom m_atom,
00925                         PPAtom  atom, int & atom_index,
00926                         int  chain_ext );
00927 
00928       void  GetAIndexRange ( int & i1, int & i2 );
00929

01060       //  _copy(PModel,PPAtom,int&) does copy atoms into array 'atom'
01061       // starting from position atom_index. 'atom' should be able to
01062       // accept all new atoms - no checks on the length of 'atom'
01063       // is being made. This function should not be used in applications.
